## Trias Smart Contract (based on Fabric)
![image][total]
### 1. Overall design ideas
- Smart contract
    - Smart contract writing
    - compile to get the compiled file
    - Store to IPFS
- Contract call
    - Client initiates an api interface call
    - TM receives the request message
    - Check if the local contract has been loaded, if not loaded, perform the following two steps
        - Download the contract from IPFS
        - Load contract file
    - Calculate the api consumption gas and the gas check paid by the client
    - Execute the api operation
- Basic interface call
    - Interface provided by TM, virtual machine directly called
### 2.Detailed description
#### Smart Contract

- The first version supports smart contracts written in go language, compiled go executable files after the contract is written

        go build -o sample
        
- Call the IPFS interface to upload the file (sample), store it to IPFS, and obtain the address information.

#### Contract call
- Client calls a contract to the TM, including the following information


        {
        "contractAddress":"sample",
        "contractName":"sample",
        "md5":"sample",
        "payGas":1000,
        "callArgs":"{\"Args\":[\"invoke\",\"a\",\"b\",\"10\"]}",
        "token":"sample"
        ……
    }



- TM checks if the local contract is installed according to the address of the request information, MD5
    - If not installed, download the contract from IPFS
    - Loading contract into virtual machine (two issues)
- Compare the gas consumed by the contract Api with the gas paid by the client. If it is not satisfied, it will return failure and will not be executed.
    - How to roll back the data if the gas is consumed during the execution?
- Perform api operations

#### Basic interface call
- The interface provided by the TM is directly called to the virtual machine
- Subsequent consensus virtual machines do not participate
